Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average...okay”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: First time with my sisters was a decent experience. It is hard to find a room that accepts triple hence this was attractive. Location is excellent to shops, restaurants and major attraction. Gran Via offers tourist experiences all times of the day and night. There are bus transport opportunities as well as walking. Interiors of this hotel is dark and modern. The room is same with some wood finishes. It is still welcoming when you get to room and then.....transparent bathroom right there to the side. It takes getting used to. On our second stay, my son had to leave room whenever my daughter and I had to use bathroom. Linens and towels are clean and fresh. Room and bathroom very clean. The third bed is a pulldown from the wall, not exactly a Murphy bed, more like a cruise ship pulldown, but it works. It is narrow so, that may be a factor when booking this. Breakfast variety is ok but overpriced. My daughter favored a bakeshop on the main ave. The reception staff is professional but indifferent. Spoke English well. Hotel is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard but coming up short”
Reviews.Author: SeeSleepEat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a group known as “high-tech hotels”, but there was nothing very special, and even less high-tech about this place. The reception was mediocre and bordered on unfriendly. There were a few laptops in the lobby that were available to guests and all the hallways to the rooms were dark and barely lit on purpose for a stylized effect. But once in the room, there was nothing exceptional to warrant a high-tech experience. Worst of all, the internet connection was the weakest out of the dozen hotels we stayed in throughout Spain, including those in small towns. The bathroom was very modern but the shower drain plugged up immediately and flooded the floor. The only redeeming quality of this hotel was its close location to the main road (Calle Gran Via) and to the main metro station Puerta del Sol. But as it is on a smaller side street, you will surely pass a few prostitutes at night (and even during the day) on your way to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: EnggGator
Reviews.Content: The location itself is great. Near Gran Via, puerto del sol etc. Good restraunts and even a flamenco dance place near by. The lobby area is a bit small but the rooms were large (family of 4) with a large bed and 2 bunk beds. A/C worked fine during our stay. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Had some issues with the bunk beds and the locker, but these were quickly resolved. Would stay here again if I have the chance to visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: balablues
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the service and it is great value for money. For the price the location is unbeatable. We were out pretty late most nights and could easily make our way back to the hotel. Staff were very helpful and the rooms were great. I traveled with a friend (who is not my partner) and the near transparent bathroom doors were quite an inconvenience. I would not advise the hotel (we stayed in two different rooms over two days) for non couples.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location between Gran Via and Puerta del Sol”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife before flying out of Madrid that next morning. The hotel is off the main pedestian walkway between Gran Via and Puerta del Sol (easy to stash purchases, before going out, again.) We were on the third floor (street facing) and there was no street noise. Starbucks in 1/2 a block (useful since the room didn't have a coffee maker). Lots of eating options; small grocery store across the street. Got two complementary bottles of wine in the room. Would stay there again base of value for your money. Oh, there is a small flat screen TV affix high on the wall opposite the bed. The reception was atrocious - good thing didn't spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice room for 4”
Reviews.Author: LThang
Reviews.Content: We like the location - near to metro stops and shopping. The major tourist attractions, such as Prado, Plaza Mayor and the palace are all within walking distance. We are a family of 4 so we chose a room with a double bed and double deck beds. The room is clean and modern, considered spacious and has small balconies on both sides making the room bright and airy in the day. The staff are helpful and friendly, making an effort to enable us to check in earlier. We will certainly return to stay here if we visit Madrid again. Just a final note - as there are quite a few Petit palace hotel branches in the vicinity, it can get confusing, this one is located on Plaza del Carmen just next to an Italian restaurant. There is another one also called Tres Cruces too, just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Regan29
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a hotel if you have a car. Reception was open 24/7 and front door only opened by them. The were friendly and spoke good english. Rooms are small but adequate. Our one had no view but because of this we also had no street noise. After all, we're not in Madrid to sit in a hotel room. Hotel is a bit old but it was clean and has had a refit in the past few years. Location is great. Only 200 metres from Gran Via so moving luggage to Metro was easy. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not perfect either”
Reviews.Author: Boardguy55
Reviews.Content: See review below from Astrid79. Well said! Especially the whole bathroom fiasco.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no comfort”
Reviews.Author: Astrid79
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 3 persons at the hotel for 4 days. The location is good: close to the metro station, shopping streets and restaurants, but the rooms are not particularly comfortable. Initially, we were given a small room with a double bed and extra bed in it, which did not leave us any room to move around (the person in the last bed would have to climb over the double bed to get out). We complained at the desk and the staff immediately put us in a family room (301), which had a double bed and 2 bunk beds. It was slightly bigger, but had more room to move around in. The bathroom lacked any privacy, as the wall separating it from the bedroom was of stained glass and the door could not be shut entirely. Not very nice when you're on the toilet and your friends are on the other side of the partition.... The shower was fancy, but as there was no door to close it with, the water sprayed everywhere, soaking the bathroom and the edge of the bedroom as well. The beds were the most disappointing of all, very hard matrasses, which hurt our backs. I did not get a good night's sleep at all, neither did my friends. The TV only had Spanish and German (!) channels, so we did not use it, nor did we have breakfast in the hotel, as we thought it too expensive. We went out for breakfast instead. Good points of the hotel are the staff, the free umbrella service and the free wifi. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel, because there are more hotels in the same location that are probably more comfortable to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the chaos, but close enough to enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: AK266
Reviews.Content: We switched to this hotel after having a bad experience with another Petit Palace location. Thank goodness we came here! It's in a quiet area, only a few minutes walk to Puerta del Sol. There is a nice Italian restaurant next door. The staff was amazing! Helped us with any and every question. The quadruple room was spacious, considering there were two adjacent twin beds and a bunk bed! We used the in-room safe. There are also two closets for extra storage. The bathroom is spacious. Even the lobby is nice... there is a tv, with sofas, water, and a coffee maker. This hotel is MUCH MUCH better than the Arenal and Puerta del Sol locations. The hotel looks newer, rooms look newer, and the staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “central and good value”
Reviews.Author: paolok66
Reviews.Content: went back to Madrid for a long week end over New Year eve in 2011 . The hotel is very central off the Gran Via on a side street on the way to Sol , Chueca is 2 minutes on foot , overall great location . Room was a good size and bathroom functional with a great shower , WIFI worked very well and as complimentary . The safe in the room was big enough for my mac and I pad and very easy to work with any CC ( again complimentary ) Considering that the room was not expensive at all I will go back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean budget hotel located yards away from Gran Via strip & tube station”
Reviews.Author: farmer1874
Reviews.Content: Excellent clean budget hotel located yards away from Gran Via strip

Reviews.Title: “Like a very nice hostel”
Reviews.Author: 907Anonymous
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 2 nights, and didn't love this hotel, but there was nothing drastically wrong. It was clean and reasonably well-appointed, but fell apart at the seams. The safe didn't work - and no one arrived to fix it - the front desk staff upon our arrival were not particularly welcoming, and the bathroom, while clearly filled with new things, had a ridiculously fancy shower head - out of which almost no water came (and it sprayed in every direction, soaking the entire bathroom). And, surprisingly to us, the bathroom door was just a glass door that swung both ways! So no privacy. Breakfast was so-so, and was an extra charge. We had a room in the back of the hotel, with no view (except of other windows, where across the way other guests kept leaving their curtains open and clothes off...). It seems there are cute front rooms with little Juliet balconies, that might be nicer. The location is great, however - we were right at a Metro stop (Gran Via) and walking distance to Plaza del Sol, and a bit further to Plaza Santa Ana. That was a big plus as we tried to find our way around the city - and for returning midday for siesta. Plus wifi was included, which I appreciated as well. Housekeeping stopped by and were up to par as well. NOTE: If you are sensitive to scents, you will have problems in this hotel. I'm not, but I did notice that there are air deodorizers EVERYWHERE in the building, and it seems as if they even scent the air coming out of the air ducts! Overall: spartan digs, nothing luxurious that would make you want to hang at the hotel, but it got the job done and location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go if you have got a car”
Reviews.Author: filippobull
Reviews.Content: If you have got a car don't choose this hotel, it's too near the centre: 22 € per day garage fee. The room was smelling both days (maybe because of the carpet), a very bad smell. Water spills out from the shower in the bathroom. Receptionists aren't so nice as well. It wasn't a double bed but two twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the pessimists”
Reviews.Author: Herts15
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be a hotel of horrors according to some reviewers...all of it unsubstantiated claims. The location is fantastic, two minutes walk from Gran Via Metro station. Yes there's graffiti on the exterior walls but the hotel can't control that. Breakfast was ample and delicious, the staff are extremely helpful and pleasant and the rooms are adequate, clean and with luxury bathrooms...can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “good location but needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: eska09
Reviews.Content: It's clean, but room and bathroom both need renovation. Rooms themselves are medium sized, the street it stands on is rather narrow and drab, but location is excellent - in the very heart of city center. If you are going to walk Madrid all the day and some part of the night - it's great. WIFI is free.

Reviews.Title: “good location - clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimbobjoe99
Reviews.Content: Very good central location. The rooms were fairly small but clean and tidy. Staff were helpful. They booked us a taxi to the airport and helped us with directions etc. couldn't really fault the place. It was good value for the amount we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: dustyndave
Reviews.Content: Booked a two-night weekend stay at a rate of 117 euros room only per night as a break in the middle of a two-week business trip around Europe. I had booked and was confirmed a double for sole use away from the elevator. Arrived (with a colleague also staying there) and was checked into the smallest, hottest room next to the lift. the room is the one in the last photo above - bunk beds. What that photo does not show you is that the bed above is inches way from your face when folded up and is just an accident waiting to happen. Only a single sheet on the bed and one flat pillow. I went to see my colleague to find they had been allocated a large double for sole use. I went to complain at reception and ask for a room move but they said they were full and would move me the next day. After much haggling, they also reduced my room rate a little. Next day, I had apparaently left it too late to request a room move and so they could not do anything. I refused to pay for that horrible room again. I demanded a move to another hotel at the same rate but they refused to help. In tact, the receptionist, Pedro, was rude and very unhelpful and was muttering and smirking throughout my entire discussion with him. I eventually spoke to the Manager by telephone who agreed to find me another hotel (begrudgingly). I was moved to the Cliper around the corner which was much nicer and had more polite staff as well. I would never use this hotel again. I agree with other comment about the glass bathroom door that does not lock, the grafitti all over the outside of the building and the "shady" characters around at night. Take my advice and stay somewhere where your custom will be appreciated because the staff at the Tres Cruces certainly don't value you!

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, expensive to stay, graffiti”
Reviews.Author: Jolliess
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with Xcapewithus.com at £291 for 3 nights, when confirming the booking by phone direct to the hotel, the day before we were due to arrive, we were informed that our reservation had been cancelled by Xcapewithus.com, who apparently had gone bust, we received no notification from them. The hotel then told me they had no rooms left, then I was asked if I had paid in full to Xcapewithus, I said no, he then, surprise surprise found us a room, at a cost of £425, decided against it, glad we did, Hotel not situated in a nice area, it looks small and pokey and there is graffiti on the walls outside .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modern hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: CorsetQueen
Reviews.Content: After a disastrous experience with a hotsal I had originally booked, I stumbled across this hotel through lastminute.com. This is a High Tech hotel which is a chain of modern, business hotels located at various points across the city and at either 3 or 4 star. It was fantastic! The staff on reception were friendly, helpful and spoke a good level of English. The rooms whilst small, were spotlessly clean, modern in decor with a fantastic massage shower all at a very reasonable price. There is even a small restaurant serving breakfast and it provides free internet should you need it. This particular hotel is centrally located just off Gran Via (close to the metro) and is within walking distance to many attractions, bars and restaurants. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very central but I hated the bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: McGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new and clean and is in a very central location. The rooms are small and basic but fine. Staff at the front desk were very pleasant. One might need to exercise caution leaving the hotel at night, as there were a lot of shady characters about to say the least. The thing I would change about this hotel was the bathroom door, which was frosted glass, and did not lock. If you are a bit of a prude like me and do not want your partner viewing you ( albeit a frosted shadow) while you are conducting your bathroom activities then do nor stay here!! definitely not a spot for a romantic break!! Having said that - ideal location and fine as a budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nairka
Reviews.Content: The location is superb !!!! Very cosy and nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HBread
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August. The location is great, very central and close to Gran Via, Sol & Plaza de Mayor. We didn't notice any noise at night, despite quite a lot of people being on the street outside our room. The room was quite small, but very comfortable, the air conditioning was really good, as August is the hottest month in Madrid. The bathroom was really chic and modern and the shower was fabulous. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MikeN_GR
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a central Location. You have near by (walking distance) a lot of Bars and shopping area. Metro is les than a minute walk. The hotel was very clean; interior design was modern and very nice; people don’t speak a lot of English (only basic but who dose in Spain ;-), it didn’t bother me any way); area is safe. I would definitely recommend it and if visiting Madrid again I would be glad to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tessyperu
Reviews.Content: Small, clean rooms, very good internet connection, good location in downtown Madrid close to Puerta del Sol, Gran Via, Plaza Mayor and others. There is no parking!!!! if you have rented a car it is difficult to arrive, the streets are very narrow and the traffic terrible!!. Parking service is provided by another company, very expensive!! 20 euros per day!!!!. the front desk staff is nice, at first they are not so welcoming but then they are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoDiCola
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - right next to the "Gran Via" metro station and walking distance from "Plaza Mayor". Good base to explore the city. Internet in the room worked fine. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianloveday
Reviews.Content: This a very good value hotel. Its position is perfect as all the major sites are within 30 minutes walking distance, also the Gran Via metro station is a 2 minute walk away. Our room was on the ground floor facing the inner courtyard which should have been quiet .I suggest you avoid Room 01 as it is next to reception and the sound proofing is poor. It looked as though the room had been recently refurbished to a high standard. We found the staff friendly and helpful. It is worth buying a 10 trip Metrobus ticket which is good value . We shared the ticket, which can be a bit of a fiddle passing through the automatic barriers ,as we needed to pass the ticket back over the the barrier on each entry .You need to pay a 1 euro airport supplement per person for the metro into and out of the airport. The area across the other side of the Gran Via is a bit rundown and full of "ladies of the night"! There is a fantastic choice of good restaurants in the area of Plaza de la Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor, within a 15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: me881
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 2 nights and found hotel to be very clean and in a great location literally just around the corner from the subway on Gran Via. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful letting us check in early as our room was vacant, we arrived at 11:45am expecting to have our luggage stored and have to return later. We stayed in a family room and the kids loved the bunk beds and the room was a decent size for a quad. There was no bar in the hotel but lots in the vicinity likewise for restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to all especially if you are looking for a family room.

Reviews.Title: “Almost got it right”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMEND (with reservations). Hotel is part of the High Tech hotel group which has a number of area hotels. The hotel attempts to be chic n' cool at a moderate price. This property is just feet away from the main metro stop, Gran Via. Off on a side street, rooms facing the street may get quite a bit of noise (not from cars, but from clubs and late night people drinking on the streets). Check-in and service throught was indifferent. Not unfriendly, just not welcoming (a clerk at another hotel told me that this chain has a poor reputation for how they treat employees - if true, it shows). We had a room looking at the inner courtyard (so very quiet). Hallways, as noted, are quite dark. Gray seems to be the color theme. Wooden stairs and landing may creak, so if you're room is close, you may hear it all night long. Our room (212) was very small, but typical for Madrid, and alone along the hallway, so we heard none of the other rooms or stairs. Bedding was adequate, though the bed itself though stylish, was cheaply made. Free internet access though. Bathrooms were a highlight. Modern, bright and the shower nozzles were one of the best I've ever seen. Bathrooms good size. The location is quite convenient to Cheuca and Gran Via. Would I return again? Maybe, but I'd likely scout out some other area properties first.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better...”
Reviews.Author: gambl-R
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights this March. I've booked the room via otel.com website, which was much more cheaper than booking directly at the hotel. The checking in was a little slow + the receptionist couldn't find out my nationality from my passport. We got the room No. 209. on the second floor. The room was all right, not very big, but nice bathroom, LCD TV on the wall, etc. But we have found a few problems as well. One of the blankets was dirty, and we'd realized that more of the spots in the ceiling were hanging down. They seemed to be ready to fall down at any moment. One of them obstructed he opening of the bathroom door. I went down complaining to the reception. The receptionist promised me to call the technical support next day, and changed the dirty blanket. In spite of this promise, nobody fixed it during our stay...We've had other technical problem too. The lock of our room went wrong, and we were not able to close it. This problem was solved by the time we got back in the evening. We've had good experiences too. For example the breakfast was great. Wide range of cold and warm drinks and foods every morning. The biggest advantage of the hotel is the location. I don't say that it would be a bad hotel, but not as good as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel1010
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel set in a great location, close to all shops. Rooms were a little small but were very comfortable, clean and brand new. There was also free internet access in the foyer of the hotel. Overall, a great hotel and would definitely recommend it to people who wish to stay in central madrid at a cheaper price than most hotels in Europe. Stay here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: smartnik
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last moment and was obviously a bit apprehensive, especially after reading some negative impressions here, on TripAdvisor. However, the hotel turned out to be a real gem in the centre of Madrid. First of all, the location is excellent. It is on a narrow street a few steps away from GranVia, which makes it both calm and close to everything. It is also equidistant from the Royal Palace and the Prado Museum which are located on the opposite ends of GranVia. On the inside, the hotel is nice, clean, with a fresh and resolutely modern outlook. The bathroom is spotlessly clean and features a massage shower. Free wi-fi is available in the rooms and two public computers sit in the lobby. I found the breakfast to be quite expensive (12 euros) and decided against taking it, preferring to eat at the nearby Vitamina café (calle Chinchilla).

Reviews.Title: “Euro-chic in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LisaBeagle
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms are incredibly small (think NYC small), but very efficient with lots of storage. The decor is Euro-chic and it just all works together well. The location is fantastic, just a block or two from 3 central metro stations. Despite its central location, the hotel is very quiet, to permit jet-lagged travelers a good night's sleep. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended small hotel”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: Good standard, modern interior, clean hotel. Staff was very friendly, service-minded, and had good English language skills. Location of the hotel was excellent, 50 meters from the Gran Via and a short walk to Plaza De Mayor and most attractions. Our room had an angled ceiling which made it feel somewhat smaller, but the size was good. No view since the window was in the roof. Aircondition was really quiet. Great shower with massage. The room was in general very tidy and clean. The door to the bathroom was transparent and you can see into it from the room so I suggest you share it with someone you know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaymini
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotels.com at the last minute (less than 5 days before my trip to Madrid), so I'm sure I could've found a better deal had I booked a hotel in advance. Although, I still believe I received a good deal for a decent hotel considering booking at the last minute. In any case, I was very happy with my stay at the Petit Palace Tres Cruces. I took the metro and got off at the Gran Via stop, and from there it was only barely a 5 minute walk to the hotel (which wasn't bad at all considering I had to haul my luggage with me.) The hotel is located right off the main Gran Via street area, and only a 1 to 2 minute walk down Tres Cruces. I didn't have any trouble checking in and the lobby of hotel was very nicely decorated considering it was slightly small. The internet was available free of charge on a couple of computer stations set up directly opposite the front desk. The hallway leading up to my room from the elevator was slightly dark, but then again how much time will a person really spend in the hallway...? The hotel seemingly had an overall theme of saving energy where they can, so I believe this was the reason for the dim lighting in certain areas. My room was a single room with a window facing the inside of the hotel (other hotel room windows), but I didn't really mind that. The room was clean, had a decent full/queen size bed, a plasma screen TV mounted on the wall, a safe in the closet (that operates with your credit card for security purposes, but is free of charge), and a decent sized closet for one person. The bathroom was modern and WAS AWESOME! It had a spacious stand-up shower with various jets for massaging, as well as a rain-shower head with different pressures you could adjust it to, and finally a removable shower head that had a couple different pressure settings as well. The bathroom was spacious and very clean with an ample amount of fluffy towels for one person. Also, the bathroom had a sink that was a vessel (bowl-shaped) that I thought was pretty cool. If you are the type of person that likes to spend a lot of time in your hotel room the only thing I would consider slightly bothersome is the lack of English-speaking TV channels (I had CNN on anytime I had the TV on as it was the only English channel I could find.) Also, the bed took up most of the space in the room so I wouldn't call it spacious, but it was definitely enough room for one person. The room could even be enough room for 2 people if you're not in the room most of the time other than to shower and sleep. Oh and one tip I have is that the lights in the room operate by inserting your room key card into the slot on the wall upon entering through the room's door (took me a couple minutes to figure that out since it was the first time I ever saw something like that.) The hotel staff I came across was friendly and willing to help. During my stay of 4 days and 3 nights I interacted with 4-5 members of the hotel staff and all of them were very helpful. As a matter of fact when I just generally asked where I could get any tour information, a man working at the front desk not only gave me a few pamphlets and maps, but also told me which some of the better tours were. I then found out I could also book and pay for the tours at the front desk, which I did for 3 out of my 4 tours. This was a great option and convenience that was readily available in my opinion. This hotel is within walking distance of the main areas of Puerta Del Sol and Plaza Mayor and from those areas everything else is in decent walking distance. If you're up for it, it's a bit longer of a walk to the famous art museums (Prado, Reina Sofia, Thyssen-Bournemiza) from this hotel. Although, I must admit that I'm a slow walker and still was able to get to the Prado on a slightly rainy day in about 40 minutes, if that helps give you an idea of how far it is. Oh and another tip I have is that the Prado - which is usually the busiest out of the art museums - is free on Sundays and I believe Fridays also. Although, I'm only sure of Sundays being a free day at the Prado as that's the day I went...another tourist in passing mentioned Fridays being free to me. All in all, this hotel is in a great location at a decent price (helps if you don't book at the last minute like I did), the staff was friendly and helpful, and finally the hotel room and bathroom more than met my standards of what a decent hotel room should look like. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I was in Madrid and found a good deal for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: teachertraveler_Ohio
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is SUPERB for exploring Madrid’s Historic District! It is extremely close to a metro stop and the Puerta del Sol. Breakfast is not included in the price of your room but is available for a reasonable price and we certainly recommend it! There is also a lovely Italian restaurant around the corner and a small grocery across the street from the hotel. The rooms are clean and very high-tech and modern. We had a room that would sleep four (we traveled with our teenage son) and there was just enough space though not ample. While there are refrigerators in the rooms, they are mostly stocked with items a guest must pay for to consume; there is almost no space in the frig for guests’ items. Access to the Internet is free and was very useful and appreciated. We experienced two problems – most notably with initially not being put in a room that complied with our prepaid reservations. We reserved a triple but the hotel assigned us a double with a roll-away bed. We paid for a triple – which certainly cost more and was to provide slightly more space. The staff expected us to gladly accept the smaller room. However, though it took a little discussing, the staff did ultimately resolve our issue satisfactorily and we were moved to a triple. The staff was multilingual and very informed about the area and means of transportation and getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, wonderful quad room, great value”
Reviews.Author: LA_Gals
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Booking.com (great site to book hotel rooms), pretty good location near Gran Via, though now realized that near the Prado would have been less congested. But pretty near Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor, walking disance to everything, only took the Metro once just for the experience. The hotel is modern and nice since it is relatively new. Odd hallways since it is dark gray, really dark to venture out in the hallways. The bathroom is also odd, no lock, no glass door to the shower, though pretty neat. Very little space for luggage and having to share a quad with for grown women was little hard. But overall, the breakfast buffet was great, centrally located, free internet use, helpful receptionist and the value was well worth the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Englishtourists
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petit Palace Tres Cruces Hotel in May 2007. It's quite well situated as regards Madrid's tourist attractions. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived. Instead, we had to wait about half an hour. The room was smaller than we expected and the decor was grey: grey walls, grey skirting boards, even a grey ceiling in the sleeping area. Not our choice of decor. The corridor to our room was also surprising dark. The shower room was of a good size, infact much large then expected for the size of the room, with a shower which I heard one American guest describe as "sensational". The room was very clean. We thought the room rate was a little high for the size of the room and it's few furnishings. The hotel seems to have had a refit at some time with economy in mind. There are two laptops in the foyer for the use of guests, the one I used worked but both had keys missing and were in need of attention. However, at least the one I used worked. Apart from the shower, a fairly average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to Gran Via metro (3mins walk max) and ideal area for shopping. Room smaller than photos, and lacked a chair to sit on or table to put bags on. Bed only place to sit! Power shower great but too much water comes out and possible flooding in bathroom. Breakfast is excellent, hot and cold meats and lovely coffee. Free internet access in lobby a great idea for guests. Arrived at 1pm and got room after 2pm, if arriving earlier, make it known to hotel if you need to check in early. Decent place, but ideal for a traveller on the move, not a hotel for relaxing in!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: vilepatsy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after searching for a few days somewhere centrally located for a 3 night trip to Madrid. I got a great deal from lastminute.com for a executive double room. The hotel is located literally 2 minutes from the metro station at Gran Via and was easy to walk to everywhere of interest from this base. The staff were friendly, and understanding when I had no credit card to use as a deposit for any other amenities used during my stay (basically the mini bar) as I had already paid I decided not to take my cards with me to stop me spending in the amazing cheap fashion outlets! The room was modern, clean and fresh and the only fault I had with the room was it was slightly smaller than I had expected. I chose not to partake in the hotel breakfast as i prefer to eat out then you are not set to times although the time it was served was fairly generous (730 til 1030). The mini bar was generally expensive, but the mini market across the street was very cheap and i used the mini bar as a fridge. The only thing i would have liked additional in the room is tea and coffee making facilities. I would recommend a visit to this hotel which is part of the High Tech hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Loopylalaland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of January. We found the location to be spot on, right in the middle of the city, everything was in walking distance. The hotel itself was very modern and I would say exceptional for the price (we paid about £65 per night). As other posters have mentioned the staff are not too friendly, but to be honest after saying Hola a few times we managed to get a rapport with them. The room on the 3rd floor was painted in a grey colour which was strangely comforting, it had a really comfy queen sized bed, flat screen tv and a laptop with free internet access. The bathroom had a fantastic shower. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I will stay there the next time I visit Madrid. (1 negative was the price of the minibar - 8 Euros for a tiny lemonade and water).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: Doris_2600
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights, and we loved it. The bathroom was really nice and modern, and also the rest of the room. Only thing I didn't like was the carpets on the floor. The best thing about this hotel, though, is the great location. We arrived from the airpost with the metro, and when we got off the Gran Vìa metro station (main city centre) we just got around the corner to find the hotel. I would also like to add a recommendation for a really nice restaurant; La Finca de Susana. It's located in Arlabán 4, just about 2-3 minutes walk from Puerta de Sol. It's a really nice place, with white table cloths, very friendly staff, reasonable prices amd most importantly - delicous food! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “worth it but not for the friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bettertotravel
Reviews.Content: Great location, very central. room was great although painted prison grey. Larger than we expected (number 315 a family room.) Shower room was bizarre as the door was made of glass and there was no lock! Much hilarity from kids. A smile, Hello, eye contact would have been a nice touch from any of the receptionists. One sighed when we asked if we could leave our bags till our room was ready! She didn't seem to like her job, (or us) very much!

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommended”
Reviews.Author: seymour801
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and were delighted with what we got for the low internet prices we paid. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small but still comfortable, but this is negated by the most awsome bathroom and room facilities facilities. The hydro therapy showers are amazing jetting hot water at you from all directions and the rooms all have large flat screen tvs. Location is ideal being very close to metro station and the Gran Via, providing shops and restaurants for all tastes. Would defnately reccommend to anybody. Enjoy your stay!
